channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The are human forset bikes blocking the pavement outside Hyatt Hotel on Seymour Street, 16th November
item.description:
The are human forset bikes blocking the pavement outside Hyatt Hotel on Seymour Street

item.title: AirBnB key holders attached to park wall and fence, 16th November
item.description:
Paddington Stteet Gardens. Top end of Ashland Place, near Moxon Street. Behind the recycling bins. There are a couple of key holders typically used for short term stays attache to wall and fence.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashland Place, Marylebone, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Opposite the new build works entrance alongside the railway, 16th November
item.description:
The pavement around the entrance to the new build block has been well repaired. The main damage however is on the opposite side of the road where lorries parked/unloaded. The pavement is badly broken over a long stretch alongside the railway and especially dangerous as it is now covered in leaves.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Exeter Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: E bike abandoned, 16th November
item.description:
There is an e bike at the junction of Newlyn Road and Camborne Road. It has been there for several weeks and keeps falling over across the pavement. It is very hazardous for the elderly and people with buggys. Indeed it is dangerous for all pedestrians. Please remove asap. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Newlyn Road, Falconwood, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned King size mattress, 16th November
item.description:
Someone has dumped the mattress. It is blocking the footpath, especially for those using mobility scooters.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Charlton Road, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 16th November
item.description:
There are a large number of builders rubble sacks and other accumulated rubbish lying within the woods to the north east of Watery Lane. This has clearly been there for some time and you can see where the fence has been broken to gain access
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Watery Lane, Sidcup, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black bin loaded with builder rubbish, 16th November
item.description:
AGAIN the corners of Dunsmure Rd and Wilderton Rd are being used for fly tipping. PLEASE GET CAMERAS UP AND ENFORCE

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dunsmure Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Remove ugly broken cash dispenser, 16th November
item.description:

item.title: Stories Road - Continual Flytipping, 16th November
item.description:
Yet more fly tipping here. We have repeatedly asked for this continual fly tipping problem to be addressed - yet nothing seems to have been sorted in over two years of contacting the council about this. It's a major problem - as people are coming here specifically to dump.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stories Road, Camberwell, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amount of rubbish dumped by the litter bin on Picardy Road Belvedere DA17 near the 401/469 Bus Stop, 16th November
item.description:

item.title: Broken/abandoned vehicle in Kings Hall Rd, 16th November
item.description:
This blue Audi, with is front passenger side/wheel smashed in, has been left unmoved, unattended, on the sound-bound side of Kings Hall Rd for several weeks now. It causes the north/southbound traffic flows to be ‘squished’ during peak hours, especially if/when vehicles are parked on the opposite side. Please can the council review this/ find the owner/advise accordingly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kings Hall Road, New Beckenham, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet
